md.name: descriptive
md.value: <record xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/MARC21/slim" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.loc.gov/MARC21/slim http://www.loc.gov/standards/marcxml/schema/MARC21slim.xsd"><leader>03938ctm^a22003857a^4500</leader><controlfield tag="FMT">BK</controlfield><controlfield tag="001">fsv297513</controlfield><controlfield tag="003">CZ PrCU</controlfield><controlfield tag="005">20090420112335.0</controlfield><controlfield tag="008">960520s1995^^^^xr^|||||^|||||^|||||eng|d</controlfield><datafield tag="040" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">ABD103</subfield><subfield code="b">cze</subfield><subfield code="c">ABD103</subfield><subfield code="d">ABD103</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="100" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Kořínek, Filip</subfield><subfield code="4">dis</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="245" ind1="1" ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Finanční zdroje v oblasti životního prostředí</subfield><subfield code="h">[rukopis] /</subfield><subfield code="c">Filip Kořínek ; [vedoucí práce E. Zawadzki]</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="246" ind1="1" ind2="1"><subfield code="a">Sources of financing - the environment</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="260" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">s.l.,</subfield><subfield code="c">1995</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="300" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">62 s.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Text v angličtině</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="502" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Diplomová práce (Mgr.)--Univerzita Karlova. Fakulta sociálních věd. Institut ekonomických studií, 1995</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Práce určuje a popisuje hlavní zdroje finančních prostředků na české i regionální projekty v oblasti životního prostředí. První kapitola se zaměřuje na zdroje poskytované českými státními organizacemi, nebo jejich prostřednictvím. Obsahuje také informace o různých lokálních či regionálních projektech, které získaly podporu v rámci bilaterálních či multilaterálních smluv. Druhá kapitola se věnuje zdrojům poskytovaným organizacemi a jinými subjekty ze Spojených státu amerických, a to jak z hlediska přímé podpory americké vlády (EPA), tak i nezávislých vládních agentur (US AID, Export-Import Bank, OPIC, TDA, SBA aj.) a soukromých investičních fondu. Třetí kapitola pak popisuje hlavní mezinárodní zdroje prostředků, z nichž jsou nebo mohou být financovány ekologické projekty v České republice (včetně např. Světové banky, Evropské unie a OSN).</subfield><subfield code="9">cze</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">The Czech Republic suffered substantial environmental damage under the communist regime prior to the "velvet revolution" in 1989. During that period, the government paid no attention to environmental problems. As a consequence of this attitude of the old regime, the first democratic elections in 1990 brought to the government a number of people with past experience from various environmental groups. New laws were approved establishing the Ministry of Environment and setting ambitious environmental standards and schedules for phasing them in a relatively short period of time. Total investment in the environment has increased substantially and reached about three percent of GDP (according to senior government officials) which places the Czech Republic higher than the average in Western Europe. Since 1991, the share of the emerging private sector has been increasing and currently represents over half the total funds spent. The Czech Republic has benefited from cooperation with a number of foreign countries and multilateral institutions. Foreign assistance to the Czech Republic moves increasingly from technical assistance and research and development grants towards support of investment. "Sources of Financing - the Environment" identifies and describes the major channels of funding for Czech and regional projects, including the most relevant sources of support to U.S. exports to this market. The first chapter describes funding provided by or channeled through local government bodies. It includes information on various local and regional projects funded and/or otherwise supported under bilateral or multilateral cooperation agreements. The second chapter focuses on U.S. sources of funding, including direct government support (EPA), independent government agencies (US AID, Export-Import Bank, OPIC, TDA, SBA etc.) and private government-supported investment funds and other entities.</subfield><subfield code="9">eng</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1="0" ind2="7"><subfield code="a">ekonomie</subfield><subfield code="2">czenas</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1="0" ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Zdroje finanční</subfield><subfield code="2">fsv</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1="0" ind2="7"><subfield code="a">životní prostředí</subfield><subfield code="2">fsv</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1="0" ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Práce diplomové</subfield><subfield code="2">fsv</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="651" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Česko</subfield><subfield code="2">fsv</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="653" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Česká republika</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="653" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Ekonomie</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="653" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Financování</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="653" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Prostředí</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="655" ind1=" " ind2="4"><subfield code="a">diplomové práce</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="700" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Zawadzki, E.</subfield><subfield code="4">ths</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="710" ind1="2" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Univerzita Karlova.</subfield><subfield code="b">Institut ekonomických studií</subfield><subfield code="7">xx0005480</subfield><subfield code="4">dgg</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="980" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">application.pdf</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="981" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield
